questions.question: You will lose your driving license, ....................... you get caught drinking and driving.
questions.description: We use 'if' to indicate a condition. Unless means 'if not'.

questions.question: ......................... you don't diet, you will not lose weight.
questions.description: We use 'if' to express a condition.

questions.question: I will take the job ........................ the pay is too low.
.......................... you don't quit smoking, you will fall ill.
I won't be able to launch my business ........................ I get the loan.
questions.description: Unless means 'if not'. I won't be able to launch my business if I don't get the loan.

questions.question: .......................... you don't leave my place, I will call the police.
questions.description: The above sentence can also be written as: 'Unless you leave my place, I will call the police.'

questions.question: ........................... she is late, we will go without her.
questions.description: Here we use 'if' to express a condition.

questions.question: You will look nicer ........................... you don't wear too much make-up.
......................... he gets caught he will be imprisoned.
questions.description: We use 'if' to express a condition.

questions.question: .................................... he mends his ways, he will land himself in serious trouble.
questions.description: Unless can mean 'if not'. The above sentence can also be written as: If he does not mend his ways, he will land himself in serious trouble.

questions.question: Let's go for a walk - .......................... you are too tired.
questions.description: Unless means if not. If you are too tired, you will definitely not want to go for a walk.

questions.question: ........................... she helps, we are going to be in real trouble.
questions.description: Unless means if not. The above sentence can also be written as: If she does not help, we are going to be in real trouble.
